sentences: Sinuga vaielda on sama kui joosta peaga vastu seina.
Aga üldiselt olid nad kõik nagu see Kandurgi siin – jooksid peaga vastu seina.
Ta ei saavuta ju midagi – peale trellide!
context: The word 'seina' is the genitive singular and partitive singular form of the Estonian noun 'sein', meaning 'wall'. In the provided context, it appears in the expression 'jooksma peaga vastu seina' which literally means 'to run with one's head against a wall'. This idiomatic expression describes futile, pointless action or effort. The word can also be used more generally to refer to any surface or structure.
